title: Directs superintendent of insurance to amend rules and regulations with respect to homeowners' policies
summary: Directs superintendent of insurance to amend rules and regulations with respect to homeowners' policies; also directs study of certain facets of insurance industry including, but not limited to the profitability of the property/casualty insurance in coastal areas.

       AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to homeowners'  insurance
         policies; to amend chapter 42 of the laws of 1996, amending the insur-

         certain stand-by powers of the New York property insurance  underwrit-
         ing  association,  in  relation  to attracting more competitors to the
         coastal counties

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-

    4    (C) The superintendent  shall  promulgate  rules  and  regulations  to
    5  establish  standards for the definition of "materially reduce its volume
    6  of policies" as used in this paragraph.

   13  that  if an insurer is not otherwise required to file a plan pursuant to
   14  this subparagraph, a plan shall be filed if the insurer plans to  reduce
   15  the net number of such policies it has in force in a twelve month period

    3    (II)  PROVIDED FURTHER, SUCH DEFINITION OF THE TERM "MATERIALLY REDUCE
    4  ITS VOLUME OF POLICIES" SHALL MEAN  IF  AN  INSURER  PLANS,  IN  COASTAL

    7  FIFTY-ONE OF THIS CHAPTER BY FIFTEEN PERCENT OR MORE, OR PLANS TO REDUCE

   13  THREE PERCENT OR MORE OR THE NET NUMBER OF SUCH POLICIES  IT  WRITES  BY

   15  TERM "COASTAL AREAS" SHALL MEAN THOSE AREAS THAT ARE WITHIN ONE MILE  OF
   16  A  SALTWATER  OCEAN,  SOUND,  INLET OR BAY IN THE COUNTIES OF THE BRONX,
   17  KINGS, NASSAU, QUEENS, RICHMOND, SUFFOLK AND WESTCHESTER.
   18    The provisions of  this  subparagraph  shall  not  apply  to  policies
   19  cancelled  or  nonrenewed  by  the  insured  or  policies not renewed or

   21  graph two of subsection (c) of this section.
   22    (D)  The  superintendent  shall  promulgate  rules  and regulations to
   23  establish standards to approve such an application and to define  "mini-
   24  mizes  market disruption." SUCH DEFINITION OF THE TERM "MINIMIZES MARKET

   26  HOMEOWNER'S  INSURANCE  POLICY WHO HAS BEEN CANCELLED OR TERMINATED IN A

   28  AGES AT RELATIVELY COMPARABLE PREMIUM RATES  IN  THE  PRIVATE  INSURANCE

   30    S  2. Paragraphs (h) and (i) of subdivision 1 of section 12 of chapter
   31  42 of the laws of 1996, amending the insurance law relating to  homeown-
   32  ers'  insurance and a temporary panel on homeowners' insurance coverage,
   33  as amended by chapter 136 of the laws of 2008, are  amended  and  a  new
   34  paragraph (j) is added to read as follows:
   35    (h)  an evaluation of insurer preparedness in the recovery, rebuilding
   36  and renewal processes following weather-related losses; [and]
   37    (i) an evaluation of public awareness of storm risks and  programs  to
   38  educate the public of storm risks and mitigation techniques[.]; AND
   39    (J) AN EVALUATION OF THE PROFITABILITY OF INSURERS THAT WRITE HOMEOWN-
   40  ER'S  INSURANCE IN COASTAL AREAS OF THIS STATE AND THE PROFITS OR LOSSES
   41  SUCH INSURERS SUSTAIN BY WRITING COVERAGES ALONG  THIS  STATE'S  COASTAL
   42  AREAS.  THE PANEL SHALL SPECIFICALLY ANALYZE THE REASONS WHY AND RATE AT
   43  WHICH INSURERS MAY BE WITHDRAWING FROM THE COASTAL HOMEOWNERS' INSURANCE
   44  MARKET  AND  INORDINARILY  CANCELLING  SUCH  POLICIES  OR  SUBSTANTIALLY
   45  INCREASING  INSURANCE  PREMIUM  RATES IN SUCH MARKET. FURTHER, THE PANEL
   46  SHALL STUDY THE COST OF  OBTAINING  COMPARABLE  REPLACEMENT  HOMEOWNER'S
   47  COVERAGE  FOR  THOSE  INSUREDS  WHO  HAVE BEEN CANCELLED IN SUCH COASTAL
   48  AREAS. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS PARAGRAPH, THE TERM COASTAL  HOMEOWNERS'
   49  INSURANCE  MARKET  SHALL  MEAN THOSE AREAS THAT ARE WITHIN ONE MILE OF A
   50  SALTWATER OCEAN, SOUND, INLET OR BAY  IN  THE  COUNTIES  OF  THE  BRONX,
   51  KINGS, NASSAU, QUEENS, RICHMOND, SUFFOLK, AND WESTCHESTER.
   52    S 3. Subdivision (a) of section 23 of chapter 136 of the laws of 2008,
   53  amending  the  insurance  law relating to extending the effectiveness of
   54  certain stand-by powers of the New York property insurance  underwriting
   55  association, is amended to read as follows:

       S. 1041                             3

    1    (a) The superintendent of insurance shall implement a program designed
    2  to  attract more competitors to the state's homeowners' insurance market
    3  PARTICULARLY WITH RESPECT TO THOSE COMMUNITIES THAT ARE WITHIN ONE  MILE
    4  OF  A SALTWATER OCEAN, SOUND, INLET OR BAY IN THE COUNTIES OF THE BRONX,
    5  KINGS,  NASSAU, QUEENS, RICHMOND, SUFFOLK, AND WESTCHESTER.  The program
    6  shall include, but shall not be limited to:
    7    (1) identifying, contacting and  soliciting  feedback  from  national,
    8  regional  and  other insurance carriers not currently writing homeowners
    9  insurance in the state to determine their interest in selling homeowners
   10  insurance in the state;
   11    (2) adopting specific measures to  encourage  such  insurers  to  sell
   12  homeowners' insurance in the state; and
   13    (3)  documenting  those  issues  or concerns such insurers may cite as
   14  barriers to selling homeowners insurance in the state.
   15    S 4. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to homeowners' insurance policies; to amend chapter 42 of the laws of 1996, amending the insurance law relating to homeowners' insurance and a temporary panel on homeowners' insurance coverage, in relation to the panel's evaluation regarding coastal areas; and to amend chapter 136 of the laws of 2008, amending the insurance law relating to extending the effectiveness of certain stand-by powers of the New York property insurance underwriting association, in relation to attracting more competitors to the coastal counties
